This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=HOSPITALITY-INDUSTRIES.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2015-03-04T07:17:43Z Kostas Andriotis 2015-03-04T07:17:53+00:00 2015-03-04T07:17:53+00:00 Call for papers - International Conference on Tourism (ICOT2015) - London 24-27 June 2015 https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HOSPITALITY-INDUSTRIES;5b6884bc.1503 From Tourism Policy into Practice<br>Issues and challenges in engaging policy makers and end users<br><br>London 24-27 June 2015<br><br>[cid:image003.jpg@01D0564B.545C5EA0]Following the success of the previous four International Conferences on Tourism (ICOT) and the support by the international scholarly community, the 5th ICOT conference will be held at the Department of Marketing, Branding and Tourism of Middlesex University, London, UK. The conference aims to add to the debate of tourism policies, to provide implications of policies and practical recommendations for end users including practitioners, policymakers, the industry and tourists, as well as to stimulate discussion and exchange of ideas between tourism [...] Sally North 2015-02-24T12:16:14+00:00 2015-02-24T12:16:14+00:00 New book information: Focus on Festivals: Contemporary European Case Studies and Perspectives https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=HOSPITALITY-INDUSTRIES;ac3a45a5.1502 Hello,<br>Please see below for details of an exciting new publication - Focus on<br>Festivals: Contemporary European Case Studies and Perspectives, edited<br>by Chris Newbold, Christopher Maughan, Jennie Jordan and Franco Bianchini .<br><br>Inspection copies are available to bona fide lecturers (see links below)<br>and educators will receive a 15% discount for direct (personal) orders<br>on published titles - simply enter the code FOF15 at checkout (valid<br>until 31.03.15). More information can be found through the links below<br>and on our website. We<br>have also added another exciting activity to the programme. Dr Eric Laurier<br>from the University of Edinburgh has done some superb work on hospitality<br>using observational and video techniques. He will be leading a dedicated<br>methods workshop as part of the CHME conference. Please see the final<br>programme for details. In a multidisciplinary approach, this<br>encyclopedia examines the world travel and tourism industry, which is<br>expected to grow at an annual rate of four percent in the next 10 years.<br>This rapidly expanding sector is seen in a variety of disciplines, from the<br>anthropology of tourism to the sociology of leisure to tourism<br>administration within business schools to urban studies programs. Moreover,<br>travel and tourism is now segmented into categories with disciplinary<br>foundations [...]
